name: InterContinental New York Barclay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to New York. Originally the target destination was Boston to run the marathon and we decided to extend our stay by 2 nights in New York if we are already in the USA. As I had a confirmation about my Boston marathon registration at the end of Oct 2010 I started to review the offers of well branded hotels and I also read regularly the comments on tripadvisor.com. So, I was quite up to date.
reviews.title: Good decision

reviews.text: Somewhere in December I found a new offer in Intercontinental New York Barclay which was a package offer including breakfast for a price of 289 USD +taxes/night for 2 people. As the offer was a refundable one, I booked it immediately but just after my booking I sent an e-mail to Marie-Emilie (found her a-mail in the management answers of tripadivisor.com comments), because the earlier comments showed a very mixed picture. I wanted to be sure that we can have a quiet, non-smoking king room, preferably on high floor, not close to the elevator or ice-machine. She replied immediately my e-mail informing me that she is out of the office and if it is any urgent I can contact her colleagues. When she returned to her office some days later, she answered my demands promising that they noted my demand, they will do their best to have the room type what we preferred even is she can not guarantee it.
reviews.title: Do not stay here...Terrible customer service

reviews.text: As we had more than 3 months until our trip, I kept up to check the offers of similar hotels and I also read regularly the comments on tripadvisor.com. Even if the price of Barclay’s offer was a very good one, due to the mixed opinions I was hesitating until our departure to the USA to keep the reservation or not as our special demands were not guaranteed. Some of the comments said that the rooms are small, noisy, outdated. Finally I kept my reservation and I can tell you that it was a very good decision.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.text: We arrived at about 3 PM in the afternoon, taking a taxi from Penn station, it was not more than 10 minutes, or even less. The person in check in was very kind, we received a room (1267), which was 100% in line with our expectations: non smoking, king bed, high floor (12), relatively quiet. We had a fresh fruit basket as well in the room which was really a nice surprise from the hotel management.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Unfortunately I am very sensitive on the noises, but fortunately the external noises were limited to the base load noise of the (probably) external equipments of the air-conditioning system just above the main entrance of the 1st floor, which was not an issue for us. We did not hear any disturbing noise or speech on the corridor or in the rooms next to our one.
reviews.title: The Barclay staff are the best!!

reviews.text: I just returned from the Intercontinental Barclay in New York City, where I reserved two rooms, each for a 5 night stay. Got a great rate on Priceline during a week when rates in the city were quite high.
reviews.title: So So Stay at The Barclay
Beware Priority Club Rewards
reviews.text: Despite my having emailed & phoned (twice) the hotel with several requests including one room having two beds, as well as requesting early check-in and alerting the hotel that one room would be celebrating a special occasion the hotel had no record of my requests at check-in.
No acknowledgement was ever made of my alerting the hotel to the special occasion being celebrated in one of my rooms.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: I phoned the concierge to request assistance with a bus schedule. My call was never returned.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel in Safe Area

reviews.text: The final two nights, neither room received turn down service.
reviews.title: Loved This Place!
Shabby, lame, and indifferent
reviews.text: Okay, I should start by saying that I have travelled all over the world and stayed in a lot of nice hotels including Mandarin Oriental, Ritz Carlton and others. So I stayed at the Barclay from March 24 to 27th. Paid 249 USD for the first two nights and 349 USD for the last night. At the time of booking the agent at the 1-800 IC number asked if I was celebrating a special occaision. I said that we were celebrating our ten-year anniversary. We booked a King Bed Superior and what was called the luxury escape package. The IC agent said that the hotel would "definitely do something special to honour our anniversary". I was not expecting anything spectacular however since they suggested it I was kind of looking forward to the gesture. What a let down upon arrival. No attendants available to help carry in the luggage from the taxi. Upon check in we discovered that we had been assigned a single room with only a double bed! I immediately went down to see Jose at the front desk and explained that there had been an error. Jose said that there was nothing he could do. I showed him my confirmation printout via email for a King Bed Superior. Jose smiled and said he could upgrade me to a suite for an additional $150 USD per night! He then alternatively offered me a smoking room. When i said that this was not acceptable he lowered the price of said suite to an additional 100 USD per night. I knew that he was not offering any solution so I asked to speak to the manager. Mr. Jansens the manager on duty arrived and I explained the situation. The manager was totally indifferent. He did not apologize for the mistake nor did he even bother to wish me congratulations on ten years of marriage. What a dissappointment. After further requests he finally put me in the king bed superior room that jose told me was not available. Take my advice and do not stay at this hotel. First impression is everything. Any hotel of merit must be able to admit its mistakes and take care of the customer. Ultimately the problem was resolved however there was no excuse for the utter lack of attention and customer service. This would never have happened in hotel that truly values its guests. All of the TRIP ADVISOR.COM comments about indifferent staff at the Barclay Intercontinental are totally on the mark. I loved NYC however next time i'll be staying at the Mandarin Oriental or the Rihga Royal.

reviews.title: Great NYC Hotel!
reviews.text: After searching all over the Internet, we finally held our breath and made a bid for a 4 star hotel and received our bid for the Intercontinental The Barclay.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: We read every review and decided we owed it to everyone to give our review. If you land on The Barclay, you are in for a treat!

reviews.title: nice lobby, okay room, lousy breakfast
reviews.text: We spent a week (Spring Break) at this fabulous hotel and have just returned.

Getting there: First, you have many options, and you can spend 50 bucks for a taxi, or, take the Air Train from JFK. A family of 3, with luggage, we found the Air Train to be safe and easy. Best of all $7.00 per person will land you just a short walk (3 blocks) to the Barclay. Total time is about an hour at 7:00 am on a Saturday Morning. The help with directions at the Air Train Terminal is fantastic. The folks are patient and nice.
reviews.title: Ehh, it's OK

reviews.text: Stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay two years ago and loved it. Luckily for us, my husband was there on business and his company picked up the tab. Room was large and well-furnished. Not the trendiest hotel, but we liked the location and large rooms - nice for hanging out after a hard day of work/shopping.
reviews.title: Large room, great location
Great hotel!
reviews.text: The InterContinental-The Barclay is a wonderful hotel and was a tremendous value with my Hotwire deal. The location is superb; it is only a short cab-ride from Broadway and Times Square. It is in an area populated by legendary 5-star hotels and it competes ably with them. The lobby is gorgeous with a beautiful floral arrangement.

My room was on the 5th floor facing over the lower roof. This was not a bad view since the lower roof was about 3 stories down so I really just had a view of the building across the street. Also, because it was not facing the street, the room was very quiet.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was comfortable and a good size (especially for NYC). The thermastat worked well and kept the room warm and cozy (and it was pretty cold outside when I was there). The bath amenities were thoughtfully selected. I found a shower cap and an elastic band for my hair one day and on another day there was a toothbrush with miniature toothpaste. These were individually sealed in waterproof packaging that is easy to carry in luggage. I liked that there was great-smelling hand and body soap as well as body wash. The comfort of the bed, pillows and linens are indescribable!
reviews.title: Can't complain!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, beautiful lobby, and comfortable rooms...
likes.disliked: — Rooms, especially bathroom, could have been a bit bigger.

reviews.title: Beware of overbooking
reviews.text: One negative is the water temperature in my room. I stayed Friday, Saturday, and Sunday nights. The temperature dial needed to be turned all the way hot in order to be warm enough for me. One night, it was barely lukewarm. Also, upon checking in, I noticed, the housekeeper failed to place hand or face towels in the bathroom. It was quickly rectified and was the only housekeeping issue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good points - a great Midtown location with easy access to some of New York's landmarks and a selection of reasonable restaurants nearby and a brilliant breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.text: The poor points - we changed room twice to find one that was quiet enough for sleeping in. The first deluxe room on the 4th floor was next to the lifts which were audible in the room. The second on the 6th had ill-fitting windows which let in a lot of street noise. The third on the 11th was "soundproofed" according to Reception. This meant it had a one piece (as opposed to sash) windows which was fairly new, double glazed and was, indeed, quiet. Looking out of the window it appeared that only about 10% of rooms are so fitted, the remainder have the older two piece sash windows and are therefore liable to be noisier.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: THe overall experience however was just dead average. We will look for something better next time in New York.
reviews.title: Comfortable, simple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Barclay is an excellent Hotel, not only for business but as well for leisure.
reviews.title: Great location, great business hotel but street noise will kill you

reviews.text: Perfect central location, walking distance to most of the places of interest--being business or tourism. But, what makes the real difference of this Hotel is the outstanding service.
reviews.title: This is the greatest Hotel in NYC

reviews.text: I go to New York two or three times a year. I moved from hotel to hotel trying to find the best at a price I could afford. The InterContinental Barclay is the best in that field. The service is fantastic, the rooms are larger than others in NY, and even the location in mid town is within walking distance of 5th Ave. and all the shopping you could ever want. Business or pleasure, you will know what I mean when I say this is the best place to stay in this price range.
reviews.title: Much better than their neighbors, even the Waldorf

reviews.text: The Barclay was a wonderful hotel to stay in for the three days I visited New York. The room was comfortable and clean. The lobby of the hotel was warm and welcoming with classic New York style. The staff was very helpful and friendly with all of my requests. It was excellent to be so close to the MOMA and to have such a wide variety of restaurants to choose from right across the street. I absolutely loved staying at the InterContinental New York Barclay and will highly recommend anyone looking for an excellent stay in New York.
reviews.title: A gorgeous hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: Spacious room, very comfy. Helpful staff in providing subway map and directions for dinning. Attentive wait staff in lounge. I will recommend to friends in Colorado.
reviews.title: Excellent service and beautiful hotel

reviews.text: I was used to staying in small rooms in NYC - after all, its what you're told to expect. So imagine my surprise when I opened the door of my one-bedroom suite at the Barclay - it was huge, well furnished and so comfortable.
reviews.title: very comfortable

reviews.text: I had booked using a special deal on the hotel's website, which halfway through booking, offered a "standby upgrade" to a one-bedroom suite for an additional $29 if available upon check-in. I ticked the box, and at check-in was offered the upgrade. The room rate including upgrade was an amazing $188 plus tax!
reviews.title: what a fantastic trip.

reviews.text: We had planned to go to NYC for my birthday in mid-June but could not find a rate under $200 for any decent hotel and were not going to pay $200 for a two-star hotel and pretty much cancelled our trip until a $190 room at a four-star hotel popped up on Hotwire. I was a little skeptical but figured it probably would be okay and we wouldn't use the room except to sleep so we reserved the rate. When the hotel turned out to be the Intercontinental, I was still skeptical after seeing the rooms online on their site and on this one. That having being said, the Barclay blew me away. The lobby itself looked like a five-star hotel from the 1930s - incredible ornate detail, fresh flowers, sumptuously decorated chairs and carpets in red, and gold, and ivory. I felt like I was in a movie. The front desk lady was courteous, if not overly warm, and she graciously allowed us to check in at 1:30 without fuss or comment. I expected to get the worst room (since we were hotwire customers) and I was again surprised - the room was spotlessly clean, air-conditioned, elegantly appointed, and very big for NYC standards - the bathroom was enormous! No tub, though, but there was a shower big enough for three people with a chair in it too. Towels were soft, fluffy, and plentiful/ We got a king-sized bed with fresh linens and turndown service and the TV was big and perfectly placed. We ended up spending a lot more time in the room than we had planned!!! The room-service menu was prohibitively expensive and internet costs four dollars for the first minutes, ten cents for each additional, or something crazy like that. Staff was gracious and accommodating. Anyway, I felt like I got a great deal. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Old School Luxury

reviews.text: We stayed at the Intercontinental over the Easter weekend, based on a fabulous rate from Hotwire[""]- $110/nigh for a double room!
reviews.title: Great deal in NYC

reviews.text: After having read horror stories about NYC budget hotels, we certainly were relieved to have got rooms at this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Girls' Weekend!

reviews.text: The check-in was quick and efficient, although no early check-in was offered. Just FYI, there was a $2 per bag fee to stow luggage with the bell captain. So, we just stored the 2 big suitcases, and decided to explore the surrundings with the smaller bags. Just down the street, is a smaller entrance to Grand Central station that is open only on weekdays. The hallways are clean all along the moderately long walk to the main terminal. There is a wonderful selection of restaurants at the station.
reviews.title: Good Value, Nice Hotel

reviews.text: On coming back, the rooms were ready by 3PM as promised. We had 2 rooms, and both were clean, with most amenities of a high class hotel. Room service is frightfully expensive. So, step outside for meals - there is a cafe and a couple of delis right outside. Also, if you want inexpensive groceries, head to the Duane Reed phramacy on Lexington. It is much cheaper than the delis.
reviews.title: Lush and opulent - great!

reviews.text: Bad service from front desk. Bathrooms were shocking from a hotel of this class! Bedrooms were just above average. Great location. Overall not impressed. Very poor by intercontinentals normal standard
reviews.title: Worst intercontinental I have ever stayed in!

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for our wedding night before going away on our honeymoon. The attention to detail was amazing! Beautiful room, modern yet classic design, just wonderful!
reviews.title: Amazing, I would stay there for each and every anniversary!

reviews.text: Arriving at the hotel, we very impressed by the front door and lobby. Check-in was fast, although there was no queue the staff did not take any effort to ask if we had any questions, inform about service in the hotel or even direct us to the lifts. We had two double beds in our room, although we have booked for three everything came in two (i.e. towels, soaps, slippers, glasses etc.). Had to phone reception three times to get this sorted, however, they did not manage to get all the items that we requested. The bathroom had an awful smell in it, the shower curtain had gone bad and I asked for this to be replaced. A confused cleaner came in and sprayed toilet spray all over it and said that this should fix it, it didn't. Had to phone again, and they replaced the curtain and confessed that it smelled really bad.
reviews.title: Poor customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast included on booking, it's actually $40 for two people. So if you are more than two people you end up paying. Actually, you end up paying anyway because the credit does not cover the buffet + tax + service. I asked about this at reception, as there was no mention or detail about this on booking. The male staff member was incredibly rude and made no effort to explain but simply said "read your email". I've never ever come across anything like this anywhere I've stayed before. At check-out he also had the sums all mixed up from the restaurant (about $60 too much), asking to see the original bills that I had signed he could not show these and became annoyed and said "ok, how much do you want to pay". Eventually he undercharged us with about $100, totally indifferent to what he was doing and how he was treating us.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cleaner had a routine of waking people up by ringing the door bell at 8. When answering the door, she said "I back later". This happened three times, although we had the do not disturb sign out. Seriously, the staff and service at this hotel is so flawed. The only people that acted in a professional manner was the front door and restaurant staff.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at an affordable price
Great Location for a Great Price (priceline)
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Priceline and were pleasantly surprised at the great location within walking distance of most things in NYC and really close to one of the major subway lines as well. The room was a little small but I guess that's just NYC! Just a tip... if there is a line to get a cab from the hotel, walk up to the nearest corner and get your own. The main entrance to the hotel is on a side street so not many cabs go down that street. We saw the huge line of guests waiting for a cab and got out own in a few seconds by walking up 1/2 block.

reviews.title: nice hotel
reviews.text: My husband and 10yr old daughter stayed here on April 25th for two nights and it was a very nice hotel especially for the location.We got a great rate on priceline for 159 a night.The housecleaning staff was great and the reception desk was not that great but who cares.The bed was very comfortable and we had asked for a roll away for my daughter and it was there in no time flat.I would stay here again but only if I got the great price.

reviews.title: Should be pushed up the ratings
reviews.text: Chose the Intercontinental for my husband's 30th birthday as it was recommended by Virgin Holidays and came in at a good rate compared to other lower grade hotels. We were very impressed by the service, room quality and overall stay and would highly recommend it if you can get a good deal on the price. Extremely comfortable bed and great shower. Very convenient location for all main sights and access to trains and bus tours.

reviews.title: Another fantastic priceline bargain!
reviews.text: We booked through priceline and received an amazing rate for nyc. We had a room on the 12th floor facing 48th street and it was a lovely view down to the street and quiet in the evening. The room was large enough for two with de riguer comfy linens and down pillows. The staff was relatively invisible, with a clean room and turn-down service always occuring as if by magic. A midtown location certainly makes getting anywhere a breeze. We did not eat in restaurant (traveling with a picky vegan) as excellent delis with fresh salads, soups and cereal available 24 hours on every corner. Priceline is the best!

reviews.title: great value
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent 5 days at the intercontinental for our 20th wedding anniversary.

Well I checked in at 9:30 am after getting off of a red eye. I got to the hotel and was so tired. Once I tried to log in the lady working at the hotel was rude and in fact she checked me in and said I can come back @ 3pm and get my keys. I made a stink and finally got my keys... besides that it was fine.
reviews.title: Not bad I guess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet in the lobby. Got the room on priceline for $120 a night vs. $300 a night rac rate.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had a great location as most sight seeing things were able to be done by foot or from Grand central Terminal ( 5 mins walk) Rooms were reasonably large and clean but bathrooms tiny although functionable.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the InterContinental

reviews.text: Front desk staff very offhand but we found that was the New York manner generally. Locals were more helpful when we had problems with Metro tickets.
reviews.title: Beware the Hotel Restaurant
Would not stay here again!
reviews.text: The lobby area was very impressive with lovely sofas and terrific lily floral arrangements . Never ate in the restaurants as the water in the mini bar was $7 yet only $1 in the Duane Reade across the road !!!!

Booked the hotel through a Travelzoo promotion. Even though we arrived 2 hours before check-in, the front desk staff was happy to get us our room immediately. Two minutes after we arrived in our room, the desk called to ask if our room was satisfactory and gave us the numbers to call if there was anything they could do. All of the staff, from the maids to the doormen were exceptionally polite. The room was spacious and spotless. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of fabulous shopping. Beautiful amenities. Loved it!
reviews.title: Terrific hotel

reviews.text: After reading some negative comments regarding the hotel, i was concerned and almost cancelled...Im glad I didnt. From the moment we arrived until we left after our experience was wonderful... Everyone was polite and willing to assist in any way we requested...A light bulb went out in the bath room and it was replaced within 3 minutes...
reviews.title: Better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was adequately large and clean....we did not use the room bar, because we know they are expensive at any hotel...
reviews.title: great!
Good location, nice rooms, expensive breakfast
reviews.text: YES we would stay here again, and plan to as well...None of the negative remarks noted earlier were present during our stay.

reviews.title: watch out .. they may charge you for an extra night!!
reviews.text: my wife and i stayed in the hotel from the 25th to the 31th of jan 2007, had a great time, as we are members of the hotels loyality scheme you get that little bit extra, great room always clean, polite and helpful staff only snag and a small one is the price of food and drink but hey, you dont have to eat and drink in the hotel plenty of places on your doorstep, will be back. we would highly recommend this hotel

reviews.title: pleasantly surprised!!!
reviews.text: I made my reservations at the Barclay before reading the many negative reviews about the staff.My daughter and I were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the staff, from the doorman(he literally risked his life getting us a cab) to the maids saying good morning to us while we walked down the hall.Yes, the bathroom was tiny, but the room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the location was great.I would definitely stay there again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Intercontinental for a romantic weekend away. Our room was on the fifth floor overlooking 48th st/Lexington ave. The hallways smelled musty and strange. The room was a decent size but the bathroom was impossibly small and two people could not get ready in there at once. The bathroom walls were dirty and there were dry splatters of some dark substance near the toilet who knows when the walls were cleaned. The room was also a bit dingy it looked like someone punched in our wall and just painted over it. The minbar is pricey but it is a typical minbar, $5 for water. The bed was really comfy but the sounds from the street kept us up all nite. The hotel was close to everything and the doormen were great!!!
reviews.title: Not very impressive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mom picked out this hotel as part of a package with Continental Airlines for my honeymoon. We stayed from Tuesday until Saturday morning at the end of October.
reviews.title: Very nice
Not a Hotel to visit!
reviews.text: I was pleased with the hotel, especially because I had seen a lot of reviews for NYC hotels saying that the rooms were horrendously small. The room was spacious and not too noisy. We got upgraded to a king-sized room because we arrived early in the day. The hotel staff happily stowed our luggage while we ventured out for lunch. The location was perfect. Close to the subway line but not so close that it was really noisy. There is an excellent pizza place down the block called Pizza Rustica btw (we ate pizza every day while in NYC - I can never pick out restaurants). We also ate most mornings at the Cafe Metro across the street. The hotel restaurant/bar is a little overpriced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was full of older business travellers and travelling seniors (I think we were the only couple under 30), but I suppose that is pretty typical during a weekday in October. It didn't bother us really.
reviews.title: Great Room, Great Location, Horrible Staff

description: A true heritage hotel, with its 1920-30’s decor and stunning lobby, that welcomes guests with residential warmth and luxury. In the heart of Midtown East, The New York Barclay’ s perfect location gives you access to must-see visitor attractions including Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, Times Square and Central Park. With Grand Central Terminal a few blocks away along Lexington Avenue. The New York Barclay offers great services, a refine and very unique organic restaurant and incredible Concierge ready to help you plan your visits. All of that in a smiling and So Green engaged atmosphere.
